Fields.DialogueText: Ho! Ho! Ho!
... I'm sorry. Is this a Christmas thing, or...?
I'm of the opinion that everyone should always be in the Christmas spirit, no matter the time of year. Here you go!
A red wool hat. And matching mittens?
Put them on! You're going to need them, if the rumours are true.
Rumours? Spill it.
Well... I hope you're not upset, but I may have overheard a little something while I was skating by the radio room.

Fields.MenuText: What did you hear?
Rumours aren't the way we do things on a warship.
You skated by the radio room without crashing? Color me impressed.

Fields.DialogueText: I heard something about our next mission.
I couldn't help it! It's not my fault that they left the door open!
Ha! Getting better every day! That's why I practice on my skates so much.
So is it true? That we're leading a convoy to the Arctic?
I was about to confirm Command's orders, but yes. We have to escort some merchant ships to make sure supplies arrive safely to Arkhangelsk.
Arkhangelsk? In the Soviet Union? Brrr! That's way up north. We'll be covered in ice, Captain!
It's a good thing I have this wool hat.
And mittens. Don't forget about the mittens.
I would never forget about the mittens.
Try on the hat! I know you'll look super cute!
*ALARM*
The fashion show can wait, Sheffield. We've got work to do.
Nonsense! You can wear it during the battle. It'll be your new war hat!
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Captain?
Take a good look out there.
Looks like a bunch of old barges and rusty tubs to me.
I suppose that's a fair assessment.
No need to fret, Cap. I can zip around ‘em, quick as a wink.
You've got the wrong idea, Sheffield. I don't want you to zip around them.
But I can, easily! You're talking to the Belle of a speedy warship.
A speedy warship in charge of protecting a convoy. We're going to make sure every ship makes it to the Soviet Union.
Oh... but they're so slow. How will they possibly keep up with me?

Fields.MenuText: We only go as fast as the slowest one.
They'll keep up.
We'll do our best to protect them.

Fields.DialogueText: Groan!
Or they'll be gobbled up...
I know it, Cap.
I want to do my best... and I will! I'll do my best to get them safely to the Soviet Union, as long as they do their best, too.
We'll make sure they hustle. Slow ships are easy targets.
Don't worry. I won't leave anybody behind.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hard cheese, Cap.
What are you talking about? We just loaded fresh rations.
It's just a figure of speech. The more I try to stay motivated to escort this convoy of slugs up to Arkhangelsk, the more I think about what a drag they'll be.
Is this really bothering you?
I'm not sure why you're asking me that.

Fields.MenuText: Usually you're eager and cheerful. I don't see this side of you much.
A good captain cares about everybody on board.
I have to know for sure that you're going to do your best.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to worry about me. I'm right as rain.
No cause for concern on my account.
No need for doubt, Captain! My heart's in it.
I just like to go fast. I'm a cruiser, after all.
But I promise you, the only time you'll see me cross is if anybody tries to bother our convoy. I'll go from happy to scrappy quick as a wink!
I know it. In fact, I'm counting on it, Sheffield.
If you don't mind, I'm about to zip around in my skates a bit. Just a few laps around the ship.
Be my guest.
Thanks! I'll--
*ALARM*
Hmph! Morgs ought to know not to interrupt my skating time!
Let's show them what they get for being rude...
@BATTLE
Top of the day to you, Skipper. Brought you some tea.
That's thoughtful of you, Sheffield. Thanks.
I know that I'm the ship's Belle, and I'm not trying to make the stewards look bad, but I figured you might enjoy a proper drink.
Heh, well, I appreciate your concern.
Go ahead, take a sip.

Fields.MenuText: Mmm. Delicious. It's just the way I like it.
I usually have coffee, but it's good.
Why is this making me... a little bit suspicious?

Fields.DialogueText: I've been paying attention!
That's the spirit!
Well...
I was... wondering something.  Mind if I use the radio to address our convoy, Cap?
I should have expected this.
It's just a teensy favor. Can you indulge me this one time?
Fair enough. Please don't make me regret this.
Thank you!
Ahem…
*STATIC*
Attention all ships in our convoy! Attention!
Our mission to bring food and supplies to the Soviet Union is critically important!
It will be cold. It may be dangerous. But I want you to know that I will do my best to get us to Arkhangelsk quickly and safely!
We can do it! That is all. Sheffield out!
Well said, Sheffield.
I just wanted to motivate them to do their best. I'm going to do mine.
I'm sure they appreciate your spirit.
*WHOOOONK*
Did you hear that? The ships are using their whistles to express their enthusiasm.
Either that, or they're trying to warn us about something...
My Type 79Y radar is picking up something on the horizon. Crumbs!
@BATTLE
Hey! Captain! Wait for me! I want to talk to you about-
Watch out!
*THUD*
Whoops!
Are you all right?
Oh, I'm fine. One of these days I'll make it all the way down the steps without crashing!
Taking your skates off might help.
I don't understand. How would that help?
Taking off your roller skates. It would make it easier to get down the steps.
Call me thick in the skull, but I really don't follow you, Captain.
No skates, no crashes.
Right, but... if I took off my skates, how would it still be fun to race down the steps?

Fields.MenuText: Just don't hurt yourself.
Um... I suppose it wouldn't be fun.
All of this crashing must be damaging your brain.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a Belle! And a tough one, too. It would take a lot more than falling down to hurt me.
Ha! Exactly! Don't feel silly, Captain. I had to think about it, too.
What?
I would appreciate it if you would try not to race down steps on your roller skates.
If you lost control and crashed into somebody else...
I understand. You don't want anyone to get hurt. I'll be mindful of that, Captain.
@BATTLE
I think you're missing the point.
Never mind.
... Anyone except Morganas.
Now that I can promise.
*ALARM*
What do you think, Captain?
About our convoy's progress? So far, so good, but the last skirmish with the Morganas had me worried. They've been more aggressive than I expected.
I wasn't asking about that, Captain. Use your peepers and look at this. What do you think?
I'm not sure what to think.
You can be honest with me. I'm a tough girl, you know.
Um, it looks like some sort of net made out of... What is that? Yarn? I don't understand.
Bloody hell, Cap, It's supposed to be a scarf! Well, the start of a scarf, anyways.

Fields.MenuText: Worried about keeping warm when we head further north?
Your knitting skills need some work.
I'm sure that will be a great scarf... eventually.

Fields.DialogueText: The cold shouldn't bother me too much. I was actually making it for somebody else.
That sounds like a challenge to me. I bet I can learn knitting faster than you!
Never count me out! I'll get the hang of this.
What's the inspiration for this sudden interest in knitting?
Well... I was looking for a way to show my appreciation to the crew and to keep them motivated.
As long as you aren't promising kisses to the best gun crew...
Ugh! Please don't bring that up again!
Besides, this is far more practical. I'm encouraging competition by offering a prize to the best gun crew. A set of scarves that I'm personally knitting!
That's actually... not a terrible idea.
You don't sound particularly thrilled, but I assure you that my enthusiasm will win in the end! Operation Scarf is underway!
Hey! Skating and knitting at the same time is dangerous!
Don't worry! I'll be care--
*THUD*
... ful!
*sigh*
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You're looking quite pleased with yourself today, Sheffield.
Indeed, I am. If you'd like to know why, just take a look at that gunner. That's a happy bloke with a nice new scarf on his neck!
Did you knit that red scarf for him?
That's right!

Fields.MenuText: I'm impressed at how fast you learned to knit.
That scarf isn't authorized with his uniform.
What did he do to earn that scarf?

Fields.DialogueText: Never be surprised at how quickly I get things done, Captain!
Do you try to take the fun out of everything, Captain, or does that just happen naturally?
Superior performance of his duties, Captain!
During that last skirmish with the Morgs, that gunner had his crew ready and shooting before every other team.
I can see why that would get your attention.
Quick reflexes! Well, that, and the motivation to train his gun crew to be the best.
Encouraging competition and rewarding hard work. Great job, Sheffield.
Thanks, Cap.
The crew is lucky to have you.
Ha! That's what I tell myself every morning!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It's as routine as a Morgana attack, huh?
You know it, Captain.
Damn. The further we go north, the more this wind cuts us to the bone.
Ahoy, Cap!
Cheerful as ever, I see. Give me a status report of the convoy, Sheffield.
All are accounted for. Every single rusty barge and tub, full of supplies for Arkhangelsk, is keeping up.
*FIERCE GUST OF WIND*
Good w-w-w-work.
What was that?
I said "Good work."
It sure is getting nippy, isn't it?

Fields.MenuText: I can handle it.
It is. I'm concerned about the crew.
Aren't you freezing in that outfit?

Fields.DialogueText: A stiff upper lip. How British of you, Cap!
Me, too. Whenever I have spare time, I've been knitting more scarves and hats to inspire them.
Nope!
How are you dealing with it, Sheffield?
I can feel the cold, especially the cold water on my hull, but it doesn't affect me the same way it seems to affect everybody else.
Let's make sure the other ships in our convoy are able to handle the weather, too. I don't want them to run into trouble.
Or chunks of ice.
Speaking of which, it looks like you've got some contacts on your Type 79Y. Are those chunks of ice?
Maybe, if ice could drive straight for us at twenty-five knots.
Incoming Morganas! Get us to battle stations, Sheffield.
@BATTLE
Ouch! Captain, I... Ouch!
What's wrong, Sheffield? Are you taking damage? Is it something in the engine room?
No... That's not it. OUCH! What the heck is that? It's like something is poking me over and over.
I couldn't say. Nothing caught my attention when I walked the weatherdecks, except for the teams breaking up all of the ice.
Breaking up the ice...
That's right. Up here in the Norwegian Sea, we're getting covered in it. Things are frosty topside, but I have teams clearing it away.
That must be it! I think I'm feeling whenever somebody gets in a good shot with an axe and it clangs on the... Ouch!
On the deck.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry it's uncomfortable, Sheffield.
We have to clear the ice so we don't sink.
Is there another way?

Fields.DialogueText: It's all right, Cap. I can... Ouch! I can handle it.
I understand. Ouch! That ice adds weight that could make us capsize or founder.
I don't think so. Let's just... Ouch! Get it over with.
I'll slow down a touch, to steady us while the crews are working. We can't have anyone slip or... Ow! Or fall overboard. They'd become a popsicle.
Good thinking, Sheffield.
I'm sorry it's uncomfortable for you.
Don't waste another minute worrying about it, Cap. I'm a Belle who can handle herself.
@BATTLE
Speaking of which - ouch! - my radar's picking up something... looks like Morgs, Captain.
At least they'll help break the ice.
Oi, there! Get back in line!
There you are, Sheffield. How's the convoy doing?
Glad to report that we've got things under control. Oh, pardon me for just a moment.
Gairsoppa and Black Osprey, adjust your speed by two knots. Keep up with the group!
You've really taken ownership. Great work keeping our charges organized, Sheffield.
Thanks, Skipper! It's quite a bit of fun, actually.
Nerissa! Correct your course to zero-two-seven.
That's better. Thank you, Nerissa.

Fields.MenuText: Keep pushing those convoy ships hard.
Some of those ships are old. Don't push them too hard.
You're like a proud mama duck with her ducklings.

Fields.DialogueText: That's how they'll stay inspired to keep up, Skipper. I know what I'm doing.
They all had enough heart to volunteer for the mission. Deep down, I know they can make it.
All in a tidy row. Quack quack!
Ugh!
What is it? Is your radar tingling?
You're spot on, Cap. My Type 79Y has detected incoming contacts from the east, possibly Morganas.
Let's keep them away from our ducklings.
@BATTLE
The ice is really getting heavy up here, isn't it?
Dodging all of these frozen chunks makes me feel like I'm sailing in a huge bowl of ice water.
We're all freezing our tails off, but I guess that means we're going in the right direction.
That's the right attitude, Cap. We're moving into the Barents Sea and making good time to the Soviet Union.
It's definitely getting worse as we go north, but it won't be much longer before we get to Arkhangelsk.
I'm looking forward to seeing more ice, too.

Fields.MenuText: You've got to be kidding. Why would you want to see more ice?
I'll be glad to get home. England's a tropical paradise by comparison.
If you're a masochist, sure.

Fields.DialogueText: That should be obvious, silly.
There's one thing you can't do in a tropical paradise, though.
No, really! You know why?
Ice skating!
I should have guessed...
Hah! You always have to figure out something to look forward to, right?
I look forward to bringing my crew and ship safely home.
And I'll do my best to make that happen, Captain.
@BATTLE
My radar's picking up some Morgs... The ice skating will have to wait.
Sheffield, we're having trouble spotting trouble amongst all of these fjords.
I know you know how to do your job, but - keep that radar hot.
My Type 79Y is emitting constantly, but it's not so easy to distinguish between the fjords and... whatever aren't fjords.

Fields.MenuText: The best we can do is to stay alert.
Would a Morgana really hide in a fjord?
Sometimes binoculars are better than radar.

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed. Rude and violent surprises aren't good for our convoy.
The Morgs love a good ambush. I'd put down my pounds and pence to bet "yes" on that one.
I'll use every asset I have, Cap.
I'll send some hot black tea to our lookouts. That could help perk them up.
And fight the cold.
That too.
I'll radio the other captains to see how our convoy is holding up.
Wait... Captain! I think I have incoming contacts on radar. Definitely not fjords!
Guns up, Sheffield.
@BATTLE
Multiple contacts on both sides of our convoy, Cap!
Let's drive them back, Sheffield! Not all of our convoy ships have guns to defend themselves.
I'm trying, but I can't defend both sides at once. They've got us pinched!
I don't know how they got in so close without the radar spotting them.
Hiding in the damn fjords, bloody Morgs...
@BATTLE
Damage report, all vessels.
Two ships, Cap. Black Osprey and Anselm. I can't get either one to respond to my radio calls.
I think I saw them taking some big hits. I lost them in the black smoke.
My ducklings!

Fields.MenuText: We can't change what happened to them.
We did our best. It's not your fault.
We could have fought harder.

Fields.DialogueText: That doesn't mean I won't be angry about it, Cap.
I'll try to make peace with myself about that later. Right now we have work to do.
I... I did everything I could to protect them all.
We can't give up now. The other ships still need us to be strong.
They'll be scared, too. I'll keep a stiff upper lip and make sure they see nothing but confidence.
But first we have to circle back. Radio the others and tell them we're looking for survivors. They won't last long in these icy waters.
Aye aye, Captain! I'll rescue as many as I can find.
Thanks for coming. Close my cabin door behind you.
Of course, Skipper. What did you want to discuss?
You. How are you feeling?
I'm... fine.
What's that you're carrying in your hand? Is that a piece of wood?
It's flotsam. From the Black Osprey.

Fields.MenuText: If I could bring her back, I would.
Don't beat yourself up too hard. We did our best.
Keep a brave face for the others. We don't want them losing faith.

Fields.DialogueText: I would, too. She didn't deserve that.
I know. And I know the Morganas sank her, not us.
I'll protect their spirits as well as their hulls, Cap.
We still rescued forty-three sailors before she went down.
And I'll do my best to avenge the rest of them.
We're almost to Arkhangelsk, but I know we'll have plenty of chances before we get there.
We've got one right now. Can I go? I don't want to take my eyes off our convoy.
Of course. Let's keep doing our best.
Thanks, Cap.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Keep moving, my lovely crew! My precious sailors, your bodies won't freeze if you move faster!
Everything ship-shape? Seems like you're working the crew hard today.
It was folly to think that knitting scarves and shouting words of encouragement would get us to Arkhangelsk safely. I'm going to make them strong.

Fields.MenuText: Don't overdo it. I won't have our sailors ending up with frostbite.
It's about time. Good to see you taking things seriously.
Strong is good. Don't let the crew get lazy.

Fields.DialogueText: Frostbite? I... I wouldn't hurt our crew. I won't let anybody else get hurt!
I... I guess. I was... Before, I was serious. I was...
I won't let them. I won't... I won't let anybody else down...
All right, Sheffield. Take a break for a little while.
It's that obvious, is it?
That you're hurting from losing Anselm and Black Osprey? Yes.
I don't want you to worry about me, Captain.
Losing two ships to a Morgana raid hurts. I'd actually be worried about you if it didn't bother you at all.
*ALARM*
Worry about the Morgs instead. They're the ones who are going to get hurt next!
That's what I wanted to hear. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
When is this brutal storm going to let up? The seas are tossing us around like a toy! If I haven't said so before, Sheffield, I'm impressed.
By what, Cap? If you want to flatter me properly, I'll expect you to put some effort into it.
I'm not trying to flatter you. I'm just amazed at how a steel ship can bravely face rough weather and prevail. A storm like this would flatten a building...
And yet, forward we go! Nice work, by the way.
What do you mean by that?
You put some effort into it. I'm flattered. Hahaha!

Fields.MenuText: Does this mean you're doing better?
Steady as she goes, Sheffield.
You're actually enjoying this storm, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I think so.
Can do!
It's a wild ride! I've never competed in a rodeo before, but this must be what it feels like to ride a bull!
Thanks for the boost, Captain.
We're in this together, Sheffield. Let's get our convoy through this storm together, too.
I won't let any of them fall behind.
@BATTLE
The storm has passed, but we've got a new problem, Cap.
I overheard the distress call on the radio. Sounds like Ausonia is having engine trouble.
Rudder trouble, actually. She busted some of her linkages in the storm and she's having trouble maintaining a steady course.
Slow down the convoy for a moment until we can figure this out.
You've got a plan, then, have you? I'm all ears.
Ausonia is an armed merchant cruiser, one of the few ships in our convoy with guns. It's not much, but I don't want to lose her firepower.

Fields.MenuText: Let's slow down until we can make repairs.
We could leave her behind. We're sitting ducks if we wait here.
Let's see if another ship can run alongside her and push.

Fields.DialogueText: The damage is bad. I don't think we can weld the rudder at sea.
I can't believe you would consider that option.
Ausonia is a big girl. We could push, but it would slow us down considerably.
Maybe we can find somewhere to drop her off. Somewhere safe where she could make repairs.
Let's find someplace close. Maybe we could make it to Murmansk.
Not a bad plan. Even if her supplies don't make it to Arkhangelsk, they could offload that lumber and food in Murmansk and fortify the city against the Morganas.
Set a course for Murmansk.
I'm glad we aren't going to just leave her to die.
We're going to do everything we can for the ships in our convoy, Sheffield. Each one of them.
Damn! Not now! On the radar, Captain. The Morgs are back.
Time to fight.
@BATTLE
I hate to see one of my ducklings go, Captain.
We're leaving Ausonia in good hands. Besides, those Soviets at the dock looked happy to see that she was full of food and lumber.
They'll repair her rudder, right? I mean, it would be the least bit of decent gratitude they could show for the cargo we brought them.
Don't worry, Mama Duck. I'm sure they will take good care of her.
Hmph. They'd better.

Fields.MenuText: Finish saying goodbye to Ausonia. We need to get going.
Want to get bottled up in a Soviet harbor and killed by the next Morgana raid?
We'll pick her up on the way home.

Fields.DialogueText: I promise we'll be back...
That's a negative, Cap.
Good. They ought to hurry up with those repairs so that she's ready when we get back!
Weigh anchor and get us headed to Arkhangelsk.
Aye aye, Captain. Let's get out of here before the Morgs try to trap us in here with the Soviets.
@BATTLE
Me neither.
*ALARM*
I spoke too soon...
Sheffield, is that you?
*THUD*
Reporting as ordered!
Close the door for a minute.
I know that look, Cap. You've been thinking of a question you want to ask me. And I know that if you close the door, it's probably a doozy.
Not this time. I had something to share with you. Want a drink?
Ha! You're a sly dog, getting some vodka from those Soviets.

Fields.MenuText: Was it really that obvious?
You don't approve of it?
Then have one with me.

Fields.DialogueText: We've been through a lot together, Skipper. I'd like to think I can read your mind a little bit.
You must be taking the mick, Cap. A British Belle is no stranger to a little bit of alcohol on board.
Don't mind if I do!
Consider it a celebration for the little victories, Sheffield.
Cheers!
Gulp!
Gulp!
Whew! That warms the... cough cough... cockles, doesn't it?
You know what else does? A good fight!
Not you and me, silly. The Morgs I just picked up on my Type 79Y.
How far away?
Twenty nautical miles, give or take.
Time for one more shot, then?
@BATTLE
Look out! Another big chunk of ice off the starboard bow.
What a big frozen bastard that one is! Ha! Not a problem for Shiny Sheff.
I can swerve around these bloody things all day long!
Speaking of swerving...
What's that, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: Don't get cocky. I need you to be careful.
Why are you so confident?
Did you borrow some of the vodka from my cabin?

Fields.DialogueText: Trust me, I'm being careful.
Look at it this way, Cap.
No! I promise you, my hands are steady.
I know the ice is dangerous, but look at it like a bit of a game. My competitive nature always brings out my best.
Just don't lose this game. I wouldn't give us good odds in a collision with any of these icebergs.
If the Soviets can navigate conditions like this, why can't I? What can a Soviet do that an English Belle can't?
I'm not sure how any non-Soviet could ever grow accustomed to this cold. It's biting.
Did you lose that hat I gave you? Put it on, honestly!
@BATTLE
Ah - my radar says we have Morgs inbound. A good scrum should help you keep warm!
You really have become the mama duck...
Ouch! Is the crew cleaning the ice off my hull again? Ow! It feels like they are.
Your hull and everywhere else. No choice, Sheffield. It has to be done.
I know.
Those axes don't exactly tickle, do they?
Ouch! No, they don't. Distract me! Give me something else to think about!

Fields.MenuText: Stay strong for the convoy.
We're almost to Arkhangelsk.
Read any good books lately?

Fields.DialogueText: I think about that all the time! I was hoping for a distraction...
Oof! As if I weren't impatient enough! You're right, though. The finish line isn't far off now.
Er... um... I guess I haven't. It's too hard to read when I'm roller skating all the time.
I just thought of something else, Cap. The sooner we reach our destination, the sooner I can find the perfect, flat sheet of ice... for ice skating!
You do have a one-track mind, Sheffield.
A single track is all the easier to skate upon!
@BATTLE
True. I guess you'd be crashing down the steps even more if you had a book in your hand.
Ah, there goes my radar. I guess the skating shall have to wait.
Hard cheese, Cap. Another ship took a bad hit in that last combat.
Which one?
Tregenna.
Damn. That's a lot of coal that won't get to Arkhangelsk on time.
Tregenna's steam engines are full of holes, but she's still afloat.

Fields.MenuText: We can be thankful for that, at least.
The coal is still an issue.
We need to get the rest of these ships to the Soviet Union before we lose any more of them.

Fields.DialogueText: We're blessed with more good luck, Cap. I hope we don't run out of it.
Honestly, Captain, that look on your face could spoil a saucer of milk!
The mission! That's good, Cap. Focus on the positive things.
Let's tow Tregenna somewhere safe to hide until we can come back for her.
I'll radio that plan to her captain at once.
Aaaagh!
*THUD*
Are you all right?
Just a spot of trouble with my skates. Don't worry about it.
She's quite a Belle, staying strong through all of this...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Am I hallucinating, Sheffield? I can't tell if that's the port on the horizon or just another chunk of ice.
You might be batty, but the navigator told me we're only a few miles away from Arkhangelsk.
Glad to hear that! Some of our convoy ships look like they're about to fall apart.
Don't make them clean off the ice until they get to port...
That ice is probably all that's holding them together right now.
Ice, rust, or willpower.

Fields.MenuText: I respect those ships. Coming all the way up here and trusting a warship to defend them.
The sooner we get rid of this baggage, the better.
Can't quit now.

Fields.DialogueText: Good thing that warship is the Shiny Sheff!
That's just the cold making you grumpy. I know you don't really mean that.
Don't give up yet. We're almost there!
A thousand miles from home in a frozen wasteland, and a wild girl in roller skates is keeping me sane.
Then it's settled. I, Doctor Sheffield, must deliver this terrible diagnosis. You're definitely bonkers! Haha!
Ha!
Thanks, Sheffield. I needed that.
*ALARM*
We can do it, Cap!
One more push...
@BATTLE
The convoy ships have all entered Arkhangelsk harbor, Cap. The first ones are already unloading their cargo.
We did it, Sheffield. All of those supplies are going to make a huge difference for the Soviets and the city here.
It's a shame some of the supply ships weren't able to complete their journey.

Fields.MenuText: We accomplished more than most.
At least it wasn't worse.
Don't kid yourself. You did great.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose.
Cold comfort, that.
I have a lot of mixed emotions, I suppose.
I do appreciate that you're trying to cheer me up, Cap. You've always stayed strong for me.
It's not just hot air, Sheffield. This convoy accomplished their mission because they followed a fine British cruiser. You should be proud.
Thanks, Cap.
You earned it... but if you find any hot air, blow it my direction. This port's a cold one.
My radar's found something almost as good. Perhaps a fight with some Morgs will warm your heart!
Unbelievable. Let's reward their persistence with a few holes, shall we?
@BATTLE
Brrr! Don't mention any more cold...
Thawing out, Cap? The waters here in the Norwegian Sea feel tropical compared to all of that ice in the Barents.
If you can fire your boilers any hotter, please do. I can still feel the ice in my bones.
Will we ever be warm again?
I might be able to help with that.
Oh... You aren't about to suggest a drink of that Soviet vodka, are you? I could have sworn I ordered the last of it thrown overboard.
Come on, Skipper. If a certain Belle saved just one bottle of that undignified stuff, you couldn't possibly be upset with her. Could you?
My heart would forgive her, even if my guts might live to regret it.
I'll find us two glasses.
Ha! Now you're talking.
I've never had a friend like you before, Captain. I'm a lucky Belle for that.
It's mutual, Sheffield. I wouldn't want to swim through a frozen hell and back with anybody else. Cheers.
Cheers!
Cap, I have a question for you. Promise you won't get upset?
What's that, Sheffield?
Well... I was just thinking about our convoy up north and all of that. It made me wonder...
When are we going to do it again?
